Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Defensin 1 (Defensin-1, natural AMPs; hard ticks, Nuttalliellidae, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S; UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression:constitutive: not induced and called guard AMPs.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.87%) toIr-Def1C=G: 15%, K: 13%. GRAVY: -0.34; mol Wt: 4497.38; mol formula: C199H300N58O48S7; mol ex coeff: 4845.Chemical modification:  C5-C26, C12-C34 and C16-C36.Activity: active against Gram+ M. luteus (MIC 0.031 uM), S. aureus (MIC 1.95 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 0.98 uM), M. maritypicum (MIC 0.98 uM) but not Gram-negative bacteria P.aeruginosa (MIC > 250 uM) and E.coli (MIC > 250 uM).SAR: DTT reduction reduced activity by 100 fold.
Literature Information.Author: Guizzo MG, Frantova H, Lu S, Kozelkova T, Cíhalova K, Dycka F, Hrbatova A, Tonk-Rügen M, Perner J, Ribeiro JM, Fogaça AC, Zurek L, Kopacek P.2024
Literature Information.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2024 Aug 13;14:1450353. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2024.1450353.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: The immune factors involved in the rapid clearance of bacteria from the midgut of the tick Ixodes ricinus.
